job.title: Associate Scientist - Polysaccharide Process Development
job.description: If you are a Associate Scientist with Polysaccharide Process Development experience, please read on! We are a publicly-traded vaccine company with multiple strong therapeutic candidates in our pipeline. Our team is composed of high EQ and high IQ scientists who want to make the world a better place. We offer competitive pay, comprehensive benefits and equity. Top Reasons to Work with Us Be part of cutting-edge, meaningful research Make a difference in the world Earn a competitive salary Great Location Awesome manager What You Will Be Doing As the Associate Scientist in Polysaccharide Process Development, you will be responsible for developing process in fermentation, microbiology, biopharma and vaccines. You will have the opportunity to learn new processes. You will spend 60% + of your time in the lab. You will work with the team to design/perform experiments and present data internally. What You Need for this Position Master degree - 0 + years experience Bachelors degree - 1 + years experience Prior experience working with bioreactors for fermentation experiments What's In It for You Competitive Salary Comprehensive Benefits Equity in the company Opportunity to be part of meaningful research at a fast-growing company So, if you are a Associate Scientist with Polysaccharide Process Development experience, please apply today! Email Your Resume In Word To Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also: Alexander.Charles@CyberCoders.com Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : AC11-1645708 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.*** Alexander Charles - Recruiter - CyberCoders Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
